body_html:
Yes, you have to run configure. Basically follow the instructions https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.11/get_started/os_setup.html#installing-from-sources

If you actually want to work in-place, you can do so (see "Setting up TensorFlow for Development"). Otherwise follow the instructions from the section above. Make sure you enter the virualenv before pip install.
body_text:
Yes, you have to run configure. Basically follow the instructions https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.11/get_started/os_setup.html#installing-from-sources
If you actually want to work in-place, you can do so (see "Setting up TensorFlow for Development"). Otherwise follow the instructions from the section above. Make sure you enter the virualenv before pip install.
body:
Yes, you have to run configure. Basically follow the instructions https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.11/get_started/os_setup.html#installing-from-sources

If you actually want to work in-place, you can do so (see "Setting up TensorFlow for Development"). Otherwise follow the instructions from the section above. Make sure you enter the virualenv before pip install.
